docs.snippet: A suit says people tied to an anti-aging clinic hurt the sport by supplying drugs. It could also provide a way for Major League Baseball to pursue suspected dopers who haven’t tested positive....
docs.lead_paragraph: A suit says people tied to an anti-aging clinic hurt the sport by supplying drugs. It could also provide a way for Major League Baseball to pursue suspected dopers who haven’t tested positive.
docs.abstract: Major League Baseball officials plan to file lawsuit against number of people connected to South Florida anti-aging clinic Biogenesis of America, alleging that individuals damaged the sport by providing some of the game's biggest stars with performance-enhancing drugs.

headline.seo: Baseball Is Said to Be Suing People Linked to Florida Clinic

docs.snippet: TAMPA, Fla. — Derek Jeter’s availability for the Yankees’ season opener on April 1 is still a question mark. But General Manager Brian Cashman said with an exclamation point Thursday that Jeter would not see any more action in...
docs.lead_paragraph:
TAMPA, Fla. — Derek Jeter’s availability for the Yankees’ season opener on April 1 is still a question mark. But General Manager Brian Cashman said with an exclamation point Thursday that Jeter would not see any more action in major league spring training games.
 
Any playing time that Jeter might see between now and opening day will be in minor league games. Cashman explained that should the Yankees need to place their 38-year-old shortstop on the 15-day disabled list, they can backdate the move to March 22, thus minimizing any regular-season games Jeter might miss.
docs.abstract: Baseball Roundup; New York Yankees limit shortstop Derek Jeter to minor league games before opening day in hopes of minimizing any regular-season games he may miss; other MLB developments noted. (M)

headline.main: Grapefruit League for Jeter Ends on Technicality

docs.snippet: Jon Niese will start the Mets’ season opener against the San Diego Padres on April 1. The role was handed to Johan Santana at the start of camp, but Santana has not pitched a single game during spring training because of shoulder fatigue.&#...
docs.lead_paragraph:
Jon Niese will start the Mets’ season opener against the San Diego Padres on April 1. The role was handed to Johan Santana at the start of camp, but Santana has not pitched a single game during spring training because of shoulder fatigue.
 
“We feel very, very confident that he’s the right guy to start this off,” Manager Terry Collins said of Niese.
docs.abstract: Baseball Roundup; New York Mets pitcher Jon Niese will start season opener against San Diego Padres. (S)0

docs.snippet:
David Wright has long been seen as the de facto leader of the Mets. He began his professional career as a member the organization, rose to stardom playing third base for the club and is the longest-tenured player on the current roster.
   &#xa...
docs.lead_paragraph:
David Wright has long been seen as the de facto leader of the Mets. He began his professional career as a member the organization, rose to stardom playing third base for the club and is the longest-tenured player on the current roster.
 
The Mets made things official Thursday, naming Wright the fourth captain of the franchise.
docs.abstract: Baseball Roundup; New York Mets name third baseman David Wright the fourth captain of the franchise. (M)2

docs.abstract: David Brooks Op-Ed column highlights tournament organized by Philip E Tetlock to test whether competition could spur better predictions about world events; notes Tetlock believes better forecasting could do much to reduce partisan tensions.
